title: How to Add a Credit Card to a PayPal Account

steps.headline: Download and open the “PayPal” app.
steps.description: Search for the free PayPal app in the App Store or the Play Store. Press “Install” to download and install the app. Make sure you do not download the app titled “PayPal Here”. That is a separate app for retailers who wish to take payments using PayPal’s services.

steps.headline: Tap the settings (gear) icon.
steps.description: This menu lists a number of different account settings.

steps.headline: Tap “Banks and Cards”.
steps.description: The button is located at the top of the menu and redirects you to a menu listing your payment methods.

steps.headline: Add a new card.
steps.description: Tap “+” in the top right corner.

steps.headline: Select “Debit or credit card” from the popup menu.
steps.description: This will take you to the “Link a card” form.

steps.headline: Enter your credit card information.
steps.description: Add your credit card number, expiration date, and 3 digit security code (CSC). You can enter this information in manually or use your phone camera to take a picture.

steps.headline: Tap the camera icon next to the credit card number field to take a photo of your card.
steps.description: This will bring up your phone’s camera (with your permission) and allow you to take a photo of the card instead of entering the information manually.

steps.headline: Align the box on screen with your credit card.
steps.description: Once aligned, the PayPal app snaps a picture for you. Press “Done” to continue. You do not need to tap again to take a photo, the app will automatically capture the card once it is properly aligned. Camera scanning will only scan the credit card number. The expiration and security code must still be added manually after tapping “Done”.

steps.headline: Select a billing address.
steps.description: Select a billing address from the list if you already have one, or enter one manually. If you already have a billing address but want to add a new one, select the existing billing address and tap “+” to enter a new billing address.

steps.headline: When all the correct information is entered, press “Link Card”.
steps.description: PayPal will take a moment to verify the card information and then it will appear in the “Banks and Cards” menu.

steps.headline: Review your cards.
steps.description: If you want to edit or remove a card, open the “Banks and Cards” menu, select the card from the list, and tap the pencil icon to edit, or the trash can icon to remove. You can have multiple cards linked to your account. When you make payments with PayPal, you will be able to select from the different payment methods you have on file.

steps.headline: Log in to your PayPal account.
steps.description: Enter your email and password into the corresponding fields and press “Log in”. If you do not yet have an account, go to the PayPal homepage. Click "Sign Up" and then input an email address and password for your new account. You'll receive a confirmation email within a few minutes. Click "Activate My Account" in the confirmation email to complete your PayPal account creation. You will be automatically logged in.

steps.headline: Press the “Wallet” button in the top menu bar.
steps.description: This will redirect you to a page with all of your payment methods.

steps.headline: Press “Link Card”.
steps.description: This button appears under the “Credit and debit cards” header. This will redirect you to a form to input card information.

steps.headline: Enter your card information.
steps.description: Select “Credit” from the type of cards and enter your card number, expiration date (in the MM/YY format), and CSC (3 digit number listed on the back of the card). If you do not already have one listed on your account, you will also have to enter your card’s billing address. PayPal will auto-populate this area if you have an address on file. You can enter a new billing address on this page by selecting the address and choosing “Add a new billing address” from the dropdown.

steps.headline: When all information is added, press “Save”.
steps.description: Wait while PayPal confirms your card information. This process may take up to 30 seconds. Once your credit card is confirmed, it will be listed on the wallet page and ready to use in transactions. Only the last four digits and expiration date are displayed.

steps.headline: Review your cards listed in your PayPal wallet.
steps.description: Once you link a credit card to your PayPal account, you can edit or remove the card link by selecting the card and clicking on the "Edit" or "Remove" button. You can have multiple cards linked to your account. When you make payments with PayPal, you will be able to select from the different payment methods you have on file.
